text: Saint-Étienne-de-Bolton is a municipality of 500 people, part of the Memphrémagog Regional County Municipality in the Eastern Townships region of Quebec, Canada. ==Demographics== ===Population=== Population trend:Statistics Canada: 1996, 2001, 2006, 2011 census {| class="wikitable" |- ! Census ! Population ! Change |- | 2011 | 534 | 7.7% |- | 2006 | 496 | 7.1% |- | 2001 | 463 | 15.8% |- | 1996 | 400 | 6.1% |- | 1991 | 377 | N/A |} ===Language=== Mother tongue (2011) {| class="wikitable" |- ! Language ! Population ! Pct (%) |- | French only | 445 | 84.0% |- | English only | 60 | 11.3% |- | English and French | 5 | 0.9% |- | Non-official languages | 20 | 3.8% |} == See also == * List of municipalities in Quebec ==References== ==External links== * Category:Municipalities in Quebec Category:Incorporated places in Estrie
title: Saint-Étienne-de-Bolton, Quebec
